bibl.title: Letter from W.F. Wilson to Philip Showalter Hench, January 7, 1942

div1.p: Wilson informs Hench that "Reader's Digest" might be interested in abstracting Hench's "Conquerors of Yellow Fever."

div1.head: Letter from W.F. Wilson to Philip Showalter Hench, January 7, 1942
div1.opener:
DR. W. F. WILSON
LAKE CITY, MINNESOTA January 7, I942. 19
Dr. P. S. Hench,
Rochester, Minn.
Dear Doctor Hench:-
div1.p:
Thank you for your letter and reprint on “Conquerors of Yellow
Fever”.

The editors of Reader's Digest have abstracted several arti-
cles from Hygeia,- two in one issue, that of November I94I,
They seem to have rather a predilection toward medical subjects;-
gave a long condensation of Victor Heiser's book “An American Doctor's
Odyssey” in I936. I believe the reprint, pictures and all would be
“right down their alley”;- and they might help along your project of
memorialization.

Anyway, the matter seems worth following up.
Please let me know the outcome.
